meanings.sent1: The doctor had to reoperate on the patient to fix the mistake.
meanings.sent2: After the initial surgery, the surgeon had to reoperate due to complications.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reoperate on the dish because it was undercooked.
meanings.sent4: She decided to reoperate on her novel, adding more details to the plot.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reoperate on the engine to ensure it was running smoothly.

meanings.definition: To perform a surgical procedure again
meanings.sent1: The surgeon will reoperate on the patient to address the remaining issues.
meanings.sent2: In some cases, it is necessary to reoperate to correct any complications.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly said he would reoperate on the rabbit to find more tricks.
meanings.sent4: The teacher had to reoperate on the lesson to ensure all students understood.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to reoperate on the plant to remove the remaining pests.
